Academic Publications in Machine Learning and AI Ethics (2024)

Rishabh Bhardwaj, Duc Anh Do, and Soujanya Poria published "Language Models are Homer Simpson!" at the 62nd Annual Meeting of the Association for Computational Linguistics.
The publication focuses on safety re-alignment of fine-tuned language models through task arithmetic.
The conference was held in Bangkok, Thailand in August 2024.

Upol Ehsan, Q. Vera Liao, Samir Passi, Mark O. Riedl, and Hal Daum√© published "Seamful XAI: Operationalizing Seamful Design in Explainable AI" in Proceedings of the ACM Human-Computer Interaction.
The publication was released in April 2024.

Margaret Mitchell and colleagues published "Model Cards for Model Reporting" at the Conference on Fairness, Accountability, and Transparency.
The conference was held in January 2019.

Omar Shaikh, Michelle Lam, Joey Hejna, Yijia Shao, Michael Bernstein, and Diyi Yang authored "Show, Don't Tell: Aligning Language Models with Demonstrated Feedback" in 2024.

Shujin Wu, May Fung, Cheng Qian, Jeonghwan Kim, Dilek Hakkani-Tur, and Heng Ji wrote "Aligning LLMs with Individual Preferences via Interaction" in 2024.
